thread.title: Spectre stars will mingle with royalty at the James Bond world premiere in London
thread.title_full: Spectre stars will mingle with royalty at the James Bond world premiere in London

title: Spectre stars will mingle with royalty at the James Bond world premiere in London
text:
Spectre stars will mingle with royalty at the James Bond world premiere in London Spectre stars will mingle with royalty at the James Bond world premiere in London 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Spectre star Naomie Harris has said she is looking forward to a red carpet reunion with the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge at the film’s world premiere. 
Naomie and her co-stars including Daniel Craig, Christoph Waltz, Ben Whishaw and Ralph Fiennes will meet Prince William, his wife Kate and Prince Harry ahead of the screening of the latest 007 adventure at the Royal Albert Hall in London. 
They will be joined by the franchise’s newcomers Andrew Scott, Dave Bautista and Bond girls Lea Seydoux and Monica Bellucci, along with the film’s director Sam Mendes, and producers Michael G Wilson and Barbara Broccoli. Daniel Craig with Naomie Harris (Andrew Medichini/AP) 
The 39-year-old actress said: “I actually met them before because they attended the premiere for The Walk To Freedom, where I played Winnie Mandela. 
“They’re absolutely lovely and so charming and so brilliant at their jobs, they know exactly what to say and all the questions to ask and make you feel so comfortable and I think they’re brilliant ambassadors for the country. They didn’t mention Bond then – we talked about the film and their experience of Mandela.” The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge (Chris Jackson/PA) 
The 24th James Bond film, directed by Skyfall’s Sam Mendes, will be graced by the royals after it was selected for the Cinema and Television Benevolent Fund’s Royal Film Performance 2015. 
Spectre, the 24th instalment in the 007 franchise, is the third Bond film chosen for the Royal Film Performance since its inception in 1946, following previous premieres for Die Another Day (2002) and Skyfall (2012). Daniel Craig as James Bond in Spectre (Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer) 
Naomie, who reprises her role as Eve Moneypenny, admitted the cast are unlikely to mingle with the royals at the film’s after-party. 
She said: “I don’t think so sadly. We’re all off to Zurich the next day to do another premiere, so I think we’ll all be tucked up into bed straight away.” Share article 
For the first time, the new Bond film will open in cinemas throughout the UK on the same day as the premiere on October 26. Promoted Stories
